com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBConnectionManager

public class DBConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object

The class manages a set of connections for a given database

Constructor Detail

DBConnectionManager

public DBConnectionManager(int nDatabaseType,
                           java.lang.String sDatabaseName)
Constructor, creates a new Vector object to hold DBConnection references, and stored the database name. The database connection is created using the default name and password.

Parameters:
String, - the name of the database this connection manager is managing connections for.
See Also:
ICoreConstants.sDEFAULT_DATABASE_USER, ICoreConstants.sDEFAULT_DATABASE_PASSWORD

DBConnectionManager

public DBConnectionManager(int nDatabaseType,
                           java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                           java.lang.String sDatabaseUserName,
                           java.lang.String sDatabasePassword)
Constructor, creates a new Vector object to hold DBConnection references, and stored the database name. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when createing the connection to the database.

Parameters:
String, - the name of the database this connection manager is managing connections for.
sDatabaseUserName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the database

DBConnectionManager

public DBConnectionManager(int nDatabaseType,
                           java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                           java.lang.String sDatabaseUserName,
                           java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                           java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
Constructor, creates a new Vector object to hold DBConnection references, and stored the database name. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when createing the connection to the database.

Parameters:
String, - the name of the database this connection manager is managing connections for.
sDatabaseUserName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the database
sDatabaseIP, - the ip address or host name to use when connection to the database
Method Detail

getCreationConnection

public static java.sql.Connection getCreationConnection(int nDatabaseType,
                                                        java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                                                        java.lang.String sDatabaseUserName,
                                                        java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                                                        java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Creates a new connection to the database using the given database name, login name, and password. Create a new database with the given name

Parameters:
nDatabaseType, - the type of the database you want the connection for (e.g, MySQL, Derby).
String - sDatabaseName, the name of the database to create a connection to.
String - sDatabaseUserName, the database username to connect with.
String - sDatabasePassword, the database password to connect with.
String - sDatabaseIP, the IP address or host name to connect with.
Returns:
Connection, the new connection created to the given database
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, - when driver class file cannot be created
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

releaseConnection

public void releaseConnection(DBConnection dbcon)
Releases the given connection. If the connection has timed out, remove it.

Parameters:
DBConnection - dbcon, the connection object to release.
See Also:
com.compendium.core.db.management.DBConnection#timedOut

removeAllConnections

public boolean removeAllConnections()
Attempts to close all connections then removes them from this manager.
